title: BACnetClientRemoveListElement (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK PUBLIC FINAL BACnetClientRemoveListElement EXTENDS
BACnetClientBase
Common Behaviour Model conform (ETrigA) FB to execute a Remove-List-Element-Request in the BACnet-Network.
If execution completed successfully and xDone is TRUE, the Remove-List-Element-Request was successful.
In any other case eStatus and errorResult may hold additional information of what failed and
firstFailed holds the index of the first element, which failed to be removed.

rows.Name: xExecute
rows.Comment: Rising edge: Starts defined operationFALSE: Resets the defined operation after ready condition was reached

rows:
Max. operating time for executing
[Âµs], 0: No operating time limit

rows.Name: dwTargetDeviceNumber
rows.Comment:
The device number of the targeted device in the BACnet-
Network.

rows:
Optional: The device address of the targeted device in the BACnet-Network. If
an adress is given the given device number is ignored.

rows.Name: eStatus
rows.Comment: If an error occured, the error state.

rows:
If an error occured (this means eStatus <> BACNET_STATUS_OK), whereas the sent BACnet-Request was answered
with an specific error information, the latter is contained in this structure.

The State in which the FB is during execution:0: No execution, resetted state1: Searching for the Target-Device and a valid address for it2: Sending the BACnet-Request into the network3: Waiting for the answer (if there is one) to the BACnet-Request made in 24: Finishing the call, setting of the output variables

rows.Name: objType
rows.Comment:
The type of the object under the targeted device to remove a
list element from.

rows:
The instance number of the object under the targeted device
to remove a list element from.

The property ID of the property of the object under the
targeted device to remove a list element from.

The Index of the element in the property, where the elements
of property Contents shall be removed.

The elements to be removed from the property (compare
elements.nElements).

rows.Name: firstFailed
rows.Comment:
If the Remove-List-Element-Request failed, this variable holds the index of the first
element, which failed to be removed.
